Title: Approved by the Council of Ministers
Deadline for adoption of the regulation and revision by court
Entry into force of enforcement decree
entry into force of enforcement decree
Federal Heavy Vehicle Fee Act adopted
Federal Heavy Vehicle Fee Ordinance issued
Law passed
Description: Repeals and replaces Mozambique's October 2000 Energy Strategy

Title: Law passed
Description: Repeals and replaces Mozambique's October 2000 Energy Strategy

Title: Law passed
Description: Amended yearly

Title: Case opened
Description: Greenpeace Luxembourg presents complaint againt Minister of Social Security for him failing to respong on pension funds' investments (according to Greenpeace in 2018 27% of pension funds investments were in "dirty" industries).

Title: Case opened
Description: NGO ClientEarth filed lawsuit against Polska Grupa for their plant Belchatow to prevent them from burning lignite. According to ClientEarth, Belchatow is the largest GHG emiter in the EU.

Title: Case opened
Description: 16 children filed a petition alleging that Argentina, Brazil, France, Germany and Turkey violated their rights under the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child (ratified for the 5 countires) by making insufficient cuts to GHG emissions.They ask the Committee make findings regarding CC as a children's rights crisis, and that each respondent has caused and perpetuates CC by knowingly acting in disregard of avaialble scientific evidence.

Title: Case opened
Description: Costa Rica files an action against Nicaragua in the International Court of Justice (ICJ) alleging "incursion, occupation and use by Nicaragua's army of Costa Rican territory and breaches of Nicaragua's obligation towards Costa Rica". Costa Rica sought compensation for the loss of environmental goods and services, due to the removal of 300 trees and clearing of 6 ha of land.

Title: Case opened
Description: Members of civil society file. Suit against Government of Pakistan for failure to plant, protect, manage, preserve and conserve trees and forests in Punjab, resulting in the violation fo the Forest Act (1927) and the Trees Act (1974). They requested a writ of mandamus.

Title: Case opened
Description: First hearing - claimants present four grounds for challenge of article 209(a): 1) the Defendant failed to take into account technical evidence; 2) Failure to give effect to the Government's policy to reduce GHG emissions (Climate Change Act 2008); 3) Failure to carry out an EIA; 4) Failure to carry out a lawful consultation exercise in relation with the Framework published in 24/07/2018.Article 209(a): "Recognise the benefits of on-shore oil and gas development including unconventional hydrocarbons, for the security of energy supplies and supporting the transition to a low-carbon economy; and put in place policies to facilitate their exploitation and extraction".

Title: Case opened
Description: ExxonMobil files a challenge against Germany in the Administrative Court in Berlin regarding the free of charge allocation of GHG emission allowances by the German Emissions Trading Authority (DEHSt).

Title: Case opened
Description: Plaintiffs file a constitutional petition against the Federation fo Pakistan, alleging inaction on CC violated their fundamental rights: right to clean an healthy environment, and since CC affect women particularly, right to equal protection under the law.

Title: Case opened
Description: Province of Saskatchewan filed a reference case at the Court of Appeal asking if GGPPA was an unsconstitutional intrusion into provincial jurisdiction.

Title: Case opened
Description: Two environmental activists (Gray & Hodgson) suit Macquarie Generation power company, alleging that one of their power stations had been emitting CO2 in a manner harmful for the environment.

Title: Case opened
Description: Community in Lamu filed an appeal challenging the issuance of the EIA Licence and the process by which it was obtained.

Title: Case opened
Description: Sandra Bitter, in representation of the company, challenged this decision in the Berlin Administrative Court.

Title: Case opened
Description: In November 2013 the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency determined the amount of free emission allowances to be allocated in the third trading period.Eight (8) operators of GHG emitting facilities challenged this decision.

Title: Case opened
Description: The Compnay EPZ appealed at the Council State the decision of 23/04/2014.

Title: Case opened
Description: Schaefer Kalk challenged this decision before the Berlin Administrative Court

Title: Case opened
Description: ArcelorMittal brought action against the decision of 24/09/2013 before the Luzembourg Administrative Court.

Title: Case opened
Description: The Company brought 2 actions against the Tax Administration at the Regional Court of Bratislava, contesting the refusal for repayment and the second payment due for the second semester of 2011.

Title: Case opened
Description: INEOS brought proceedings before the Administrative Court in Berlin for the refusal of its request for emission allowances free of charge made on 23/01/2012, denied on 19/02/2014, appealed and denied again in 14/09/2015.

Title: Case opened
Description: Trinseo brought legal action against the decision of DEHSt.

Title: Case opened
Description: The Republic of Poland contested EU decision on the grounds that it affects a Member State's choice between different energy sources and the general structure of its energy supply.

Title: Case opened
Description: INEOS brought an action before the Administrative Court in Berlin for the rejection of its request to take into account additional information regarding the allocation of free allowances for the trading period 2013-2020.

Title: Case opened
Description: Friends of the Earth Netherlands and 6 other co-plaintiffs filed a case before the Hague Court of Appeals seeking ruling that Shell must reduce its Co2 emissions by 45% by 2030 compared to 2010 levels and zero by 2050, in line with the Paris Agreement. The underlying argument is that Shell has a duty to take action to reduce GHG emissions based on Art. 6:162 of the Dutch Civil Code (duty of care and human rights obligations by failing to take adequate action to curb contributions to climate change).

Title: Case opened
Description: A group of 8 islanders of Torres Strait, Australia filed a case before the UN Human Rights Committee against the government of Australia for violating the plaintiffs' human rights under International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights fue to government's failure to address climate change.

Title: Case opened
Description: ClientEarth, NGO and shareholder of Enea (utility company) filed a case against the company regarding the construction of a coal-fired power plant. The claim was brought under Polish Commercial Companies Code.

Title: Case opened
Description: The municipality of Grande-Synthe sued the French Government for insufficient action on climate change, before the Conseil d'Etat (highest administrative court in France).This is a a low-lying coastal municipality exposed to sea level rise and flooding.

Title: Case opened
Description: The advocacy group Friends of the Irish Environment (FIE) filed a suit before the High Court challengin the approval of the National Mitigation Plan as it violated Ireland's Climate Action and Low Carbon Development Act (2015).

Title: Case opened
Description: The Canadian NGO "Environnement JEUnesse" filed a case before the Superior Court of Qubec to bring action against Canadian Government on behalf of citizens aged under 35, for violating the plaintiffs' rights by setting insufficinet GHG reduction targets.

Title: Case opened
Description: H.J. Banks & Co. Ltd. Challenged the Secretary of Sate for Housing's decision of denying a planning permission for coal mining project on the grounds that it would have adverse effects on GHG emissions.

Title: Case opened
Description: Friends of the Earth reports to have lodged a constitutional complaint against German Government alleging that it hasfailed to meet its own GHG emission reduction goals.

Title: Case opened
Description: French NGO "Notre affaire  Tous" (NAAT) filed a lawsuit against the French Government before the Administrative Court in Paris due to its inadequate action on cliamte change.

Title: Case opened
Description: Three german families and Greenpeace Germany filed a lawsuit before the Berlin Adminsitrative Court against the German Govenrment for backing off its 2020 GHG emission reduction target, in violation of the plaintiffs' rights to life and health.

Title: Case opened
Description: Gloucester Resources Ltd. filed a lawsuit against the Minister of Planning appealing the denial of the company's project to construct an open cut mine in New South Wales.

Title: Case opened
Description: Plaintiffs from 6 countries filed a suit against the EU in the European General Court in Luxembourg to challenge the treatment of forest biomass as a renewable fuel in the EU's 2018 revised Renewable Energy Directive (RED II).

Title: Case opened
Description: Province of Ontario filed a suit in the Ontario Court of Appeal seeking consideration of whether GHG Pollution Pricing Act (GGPPA) is unconstitutional.

Title: Case opened
Description: Environmental groups files a lawsuit against Ontario Government alleging it failed to meet legal requirements for public consultation on regulations that would end Ontario's cap and trade program (Regulation 386/18)

Title: Case opened - First complaint
Description: Friends of the Earth and Plan B Earth, both non-profits, filed a suit against Secretary of State for Transport Chris Grayling (the Secretary) alleging inadequate consideration of climate change impacts in regardsto the expansion of Heathrow Airport. The suit was filed before the High COurt of Justice Queen's Bench Division Administrative Court.

Title: Case opened
Description: Mark McVeigh, a pension fund member filed suit against the Retail Employees Superannuation Trust (REST) alleging that it violated the Corporations Act 2001 by failing to provide information related to climate change business risks and any plans to address those risks.

Title: Case opened
Description: Representatives of the Mataatua District Maori Council filed a claim alleging that New Zealand has breached its obligations to the Maori by failing to implement policies that will address climate change. The case is still undecided.

Title: Case opened
Description: Ridhima Pandey, a 9-year-old, filed a petition arguing that the Public Trust Doctrine, India's commitments under the Paris Agreement, and India's existing environmental laws and climate-related policies oblige greater action to mitigate climate change. The case is still undecided.

Title: Case opened
Description: Greenpeace Indonesia and 3 local residents challenged the Bali Governor's granting of environmental permits for the expansion of a Coal-Fired Power Plant in Bali.
Nine Indonesian and international environmental groups filed an amici curiae brief in the proceeding before the Denpasar Administrative Court.

Title: Case opened
Description: 25 youth plaintiffs between the ages of 7-26 years old sued several bodies within the Colombian government, alleging that climate change and the government's failure to reduce deforestation and ensure compliance with a target for zero-net deforestation in the Colombian Amazon by the year 2020 (target of the National Development Plan 2014-2018) threatens their fundamental rights.

Title: Decision by lower court
Description: Court of Bogot decided against the plaintiffs.
Plaintiffs appealed this decision before the Supreme Court.

Title: Case decided by Supreme Court
Description: Supreme Court decided in favour of the plaintiffs, and ordered the government to formulate and implement action plans to address deforestation in the Amazon.

Title: Case opened
Description: 10 families from 8 countries brought an action before EU General Court seeking to compel the EU to take more stringent GHG emissions reductions.

Title: Case decided
Description: The General Court (second chamber) dismissed the case on procedural grounds, finding that the plaintiffs could not bring the case since they are not sufficiently and directly affected by these policies.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: The Plaintiffs appealed this decision. No decision has been made on the appeal.

Title: Advisory opinion requested
Description: Colombia requested to the Inter-American Court of Human Rights an advisory opinion concerning the interpretation and scope of articles related to human rights, personal integrityand right to life of the American Convention, this in relation to a healthy environment as a human right.

Title: Advisory opinion issued by Inter-American Court
Description: The Court provided and advisory opinion with respect to the three rights mentionned (life, integrity and health) saying the Government has a duty to prevent, preserve, provide informationand cooperate.

Title: Case opened
Description: Plan B Earth, non-profit, filed a climate change lawsuit against the Secretary of State for Business, Energy, and Industrial Strategy for failing to revise 2050 carbon reduction targets in the light of new international law and scientific evidence.
The Adminstratif Court found the Claimants' grounds didn't meet the permission threshold.
The Claimants appealed the decision of the Administrative Court.
The High Court found the claims were not arguable and denied permission for the case to proceed.
The Claimants the decision of the High Court.

Title: Appeal rejected
Description: The Court of Appeal rejected the Plaintiffs appeal of the High Court's decision. It is not possible to appeal this decision.

Title: Case opened
Description: Friends of the Irish Environment, non-profit, challenged the decision to issue a 5-year extension to the Dublin Airport Authority to construct a new runway.

Title: Case decided
Description: The High Court ruled against Friend of the Irish Environment arguing lack of standing, but recognized "a personal consitutional right to an environment".

Title: Case opened
Description: Plaintiffs filed a suit on behalf of 4 Ugandan minors, arguing that under the Constitution it is the duty of the State to preserve natural resources from degradation for both present and future generations.

Title: Case open
Description: The complaint was amended, no decision has been made.

Title: Case opened
Description: Petitioners object the approval of a 22-turbine on-shore wind farm, seeking for the Court to overturn it.

Title: Petition denied
Description: The Court decided to reject the petitioners request.
GroundWork, non-profit, filed a motion to revoke the Environmental Affair's authorization to develop a 600 MW coal-fired power plant. The Case is still undecided.

Title: Case opened
Comments: Couldn't find it.

Description: Shareholders of the Commonwealth Bank of Australia sued the bank alleging it violated the Corporations Act of 2001 with the issuance of its 2016 annual report, which failed to disclose climate change-related business risks.

Shareholders withdrew their suit after the CBA released a 2017 annual report that acknowledged the risk of climate change and pledged to undertake climate change scenario analysis to estimate the risks to CBA's business.

Title: Case opened
Description: Friends of the Earth and local land owners challenged mining leases granted under the Mineral Resources Act 1989 in Queensland.

Title: Case dismissed
Description: The Court dismissed the case on the grounds that GHG emissions of the mine may contribute to climate change, but this should not outweigh all other considerations in the assessment process for the mine.

Title: Case opened
Description: Local residents challenged the grant of permission to develop a 12-turbine windfarm on various grounds.

Title: Decision upheld
Description: The Tribunal decided the permission for the windfarm should be upheld.

Title: Case opened
Description: A windfarm developer whose permission to install 9 turbines has been denied, sought judicial review of this decision.

Title: Permit granted
Description: The Court decided that given the benefits of the windfarm, it should be allowed.

Title: Case opened
Description: Local residents challenged the Shire council's approval of a development of property 230 meters from the coast and in an area encompassing several ephemeral wetlands.

Title: Case closed
Description: The Tribunal decided to maintain the Council's decision, but rquired additional conditions relating to the wetlands and protections against sea level rise.
The Surf Coast Shire Council granted planning permit for the development of a wind energy facility.

Title: Case opened
Description: Local residents challenged approval of a wind farm on various grounds (noise, heritage, culture).
The Tribunal decided to maintain the Council's decision given that the windfarm is in the public's interest.

Title: Decision appealed
Description: Applicants seeking permission to develop four joined two-story units on a beachfront plot appealed the city council's denial.

Title: Permission granted
Description: The Tribunal decided to allow the development and ordered the Council to grant conditional permission for the development.

Title: Permission denied
Description: Coffs Harbour City Council denied the permission for a development application by Pridel Investments, because of high flooding risks among other factors.

Title: Decision appealed
Description: Pridel Investments challenges the Council's decision to deny permission for a 39-lot subdivision in Coffs Harbour.

Title: Case closed
Description: The Court decided the Council's decision should be upheld, and permission for the development should be denied. The Appeal was dismissed.

Title: Case opened
Description: A couple appeals the city Council's decision to deny permission to build two dwelling units near the coast in a designated flood zone.
The Tribunal upheld the Council's decision.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: The couple prepares a new vulnerability assessment and appeals the Tribunal's decision.

Title: Appeal dismissed
Description: The Court ruled that the decision by the Council should be upheld, permit is denied.

Title: Case opened
Description: A journalist challenged the government of Victoria's refusal to produce all of the documents responsive to his request under the Freedom of Information Act 1982.

Title: Case closed
Description: The Tribunal upheld the government's refusal to produce the 11 contested documents.

Title: Case opened
Description: Mr. Fetterplace appealed the shire council's denial of building permission.

Title: Permission granted
Description: The Tribunal ordered the Council to grant the building permission.

Title: Case opened
Description: Mr. Fetherston appelaed the decision by the Wollongong City Council to deny permission to build a two-story dwelling.

Title: Permit granted
Description: The Court decided to uphold the appeal, and ordered the Council to grant permission for the development of the dwelling.

Title: Case opened
Description: Mr. D'Abate challenged the Shire Council's denial of his request for permission to build a new two-story dwelling. The denial was based on the finding that the new building would intensify development in a floodplain.

Title: Permit denied
Description: The Tribunal upheld the denial on the grounds that permission to build in the desired location would put the building in the path of flooding driven by climate change and sea level rise.

Title: Case opened
Description: Residents challenged the County Council's decision to permit construction of a two-story house

Title: Permit granted
Description: The Tribunal decided to grant permission subject to the requirement that the house be elevated per Melbourne Water's recommendation (given possible sea level rise due to CC).

Title: Permit granted
Description: Minister of Environment grants permission for the construction of a new open-cut coal mine in Queensland by Adani Mining.

Title: Case opened
Description: Australian Conservation Foundation, non-profit, challenged the decision to approve a coal mine project.

Title: Permit sustained
Description: The Court decided to dismiss the application for judicial review, and mantain the permit that was granted to Adani Mining.

Title: Case opened
Description: Coast and Country Association of Queensland appealed the decision by the Ministry of Environment to grant permission for new coal mining project.

Title: Appeal dismissed
Description: The Court refused to review the Queensland Supreme Court's decision arguing that it is the lower courts' responsibility to determine factual questions, such as the scope of coal mining operations and the nature of the market for coal.

Title: Case opened
Description: Earthjustice filed a petition on behalf of the Arctic Athabaskan Council alleging that Canada's lax regulations on emissions threaten the Athabaskan people's human rights. Case was filed, it has not yet been decided.

Title: Case opened
Description: Marangopoulos Foundation for Human Rights (MFHR) alleged that the Greek government was not in compliance with Greek, European, and international law because of the nature of its oversight (and partial ownership of) several lignite coal mines and coal-fired power plants.

Title: Evidence presented
Description: Greek Government presented its case and asked the Committee to dismiss the complaint as unfounded.

Title: Case decided
Description: the Committee concluded that Greece had indeed violated several articles 2, 3, and 11 of the European Social Charter

Title: Case opened
Description: Global Legal Action on Climate Change (GLACC) filed a petition with the Supreme Court of the Philippines seeking relief from dangers arising from flooding.
Comments: We don't know the exact date, there is no link for the petition on out website and I couldn't find it on the Sabin website either.

Title: Case opened
Description: Greenpeace requested that Alberta's Securities Commission freeze, pending review, Kinder Morgan Canada's initial public offering (IPO) based on alleged deficiencies in its prospectus. Case is still undecided.
Minister of Environmental Affairs grants authorisation for the construction of a coal-fored power station.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: Earthlife Africa, non-profit, appeals the decision arguing that the EIA didn't take into account climate change.

Title: License is sustained
Description: The Ministry of Environmental Affairs maintains its decision, although it recognises CC impacts should be considered and adds an additional condition to the License: it must undertake a CC impact assessment.

Title: Second appeal filed
Description: Earthlife seeks review of the decision of granting the License and of the appeal decision, alleging under CC considerations the License shoudn't be granted.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court ruled that climate change is indeed a relevant consideration for the environmental review of the Thabametsi Project. Because the review approved by the Minister ignored climate change, the court held it to be legally invalid.

Title: Case opened
Description: A group of plaintiffs who own property along in New South Wales, Australia sought damages from the local government authority, the Byron Shire Council, to cover the costs of erecting shoreline protections on their parcels and to compensate for lost value to their properties from encroaching seas.

Title: Settlement agreed
Description: The Council's insurers agreed to a settlement.

Title: Case opened
Description: Property owners filed a class action suit against Ontario's Ministry of Natural Resources seeking compensation for property damages alleging the Ministry should've warned them about flood risks.

Title: Case discontinued
Description: The case was discontinued at the lead plaintiff's request.

Title: Case opened
Description: Various NGOs and individuals persuaded a panel of the Austrian Federal Administrative Court to overturn the government of Lower Austria's approval of construction of a third runway at Vienna's main airport.

Title: Permission revoked
Description: The Austrian Federal Administrative Court overturned the decision of approval of the construction of a third runway at Vienna's main airport.

Title: Permission granted
Description: The previous decision is repealed, the authorisation for the third runway is granted.

Title: Case opened
Description: Environmental NGOs and individual plaintiffs challenged the sale of a Swedish coal-fired power plant arguing the Swedish government's duty to care for its citizens.
The Court dismissed the case on the grounds that the plaintiffs had not suffered any injuries from the governmental decision.
Comments: We don't know the date of this decision, the website only ahs the summons document, not the decision.

Title: Case opened
Description: Landowners, the Coast and Country Association of Queensland, and the Mackay Conservation Group challenged the proposal for a large-scale coal mine, arguing that there were significant uncertainties about the impact of mining on groundwater supplies.

Title: Case decided
Description: Land Court recommended that the project be refused or that strict conditions be imposed to ensure that mining will not affect groundwater supplies.

Title: Case opened
Description: Arcelor, steel producer, challenged the validity of the ETS Directive claiming it violated several principles of Community law.

Title: Case dismissed
Description: The General Court dismissed the action for annulment as inadmissible, noting that Arcelor is neither individually nor directly concerned by the directive.

Title: Case opened
Description: The European Commission notifies the UK that the amendments to its allocation schemes are incompatible with the Directive.

Title: Case decided
Description: European Court reversed a Commission of the European Communities decision barring the UK from amending its national allocation plan (NAP) under Article 9 of Directive 2003/87.

Title: Case opened
Description: Individuals, solar installation firms and community organizations coordinated by Friends of the Earth challenged the Secretary of State's decision to reduce the rate at which recipients of a FIT for solar would be compensated.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court concluded rates could be adjusted in prospect, making it permissible for the Secretary to reduce rates for installations coming online after April 1, 2012, but not in retrospect.

Title: Amendment issued
Description: Amendment C45 came into effect in the Glenelg Planning Scheme, which required additional planning permission requirements.

Title: Application for permit
Description: The Construction, which had begun in early March 2009, seeked permission to complete the construction work of a dwelling.

Title: Case opened
Description: The Tribunal rejected the permit application on the grounds that the development plans were at odds with policies encouraging habitat maintenance and biodiversity, and also found that the development would compromise a parcel that would otherwise act as a coastal buffer - a role the Tribunal expected to grow in importance as sea levels rise.

Title: Case opened
Description: Mr. Keiller seeks before the Information Commissioner for the University of East Anglia to provide information that had been requested, which it had denied in 30/10/2009. The information requested was to produce an email and attachment related to an alleged manipulation of data of the historical climate record--the "hockey stick" graph controversy.

Title: Denied
Description: Information Commissioner ruled that the email did not need to be produced as its sender no longer had possession or control of it.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: Dr. Keiller submitted an appeal to the Tribunal.

Title: Appeal granted
Description: The Information Tribunal overturned the decision of the Information Commissioner, determining that if the email still existed then the language of the Regulation required the University to either produce it or issue a valid refusal notice.

Title: Case opened
Description: The Constitutional Council is asked to review the conformity of articles L.222-1 to L.222-3 of the Environmental Code with the Constitution.
The Constitutional Council ruled that the first sentence of art.L.222-2 of the Environmental Code is unconstitutional, rejected the unconstitutionality of the other articles.

Title: Case opened
Description: Ecuador's Constitutional Court reviewed the Cooperative Agreement on Climate Change, Conservation of Biological Diversity, and Environmental Development Between the Republic of Ecuador and the Republic of Peru.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court found no conflicts between the two documents, but concluded that the Agreement must receive legislative approval before entering into force in Ecuador.

Title: Case opened
Description: Mr. Liluya,  a Peruvian farmer filed claims for declaratory judgment and damages in a German court against RWE, Germany's largest electricity producer.

Title: Case dismissed
Description: The court dismissed the claim on the grounds that it was unfounded.

Title: Appeal recognized admissible.
Description: Appeal court recognized the complain as adminissible, and demands parties to submit evidence.

Title: Questioned licensing decision
Description: The Government of Norway awarded 10 production licenses to 13 companies for oil and gas in the Artic Barents Sea.

Title: Case opened
Description: Two NGOs sought a declaratory judgment from the Oslo District Court that Norway's Ministry of Petroleum and Energy violated the Norwegian constitution by issuing a block of oil and gas licenses.

Title: Case decided
Description: Oslo District Court ruled in favor of the Norwegian Government.

Title: Case on appeal
Description: Greenpeace Nordic and Nature and Youth appealed the decision before the Supreme Court.

Title: Case decided
Description: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) in India, on its own motion, ordered the government of Himachal Pradesh to impose a host of restrictions on traffic and to undertake a program of reforestation, both of which would be overseen by a Monitoring Committee that would make quarterly reports to the NGT.

Title: Case opened
Comments: It's not on the Sabin's webpage, and on ours I couldn't find any info on when the claim was filed.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: Mr Bhai appealed the decision that granted a forest clearence of 80.507 hectares of government forest land.

Title: Appeal denied
Description: The Tribunal concluded that there were no substantial merits calling for interference into the forest clearing in question and disposed of the appeal.

Title: Case opened
Description: The applicants challenge the construction of the road from Vitthalwadi to National Highway-4 bypass, being constructed under the Draft Development Plan.
Comments: It's not on the Sabin's webpage, and on ours I couldn't find any info on when the claim was filed.

Title: Case opened
Description: The Applicants filed Writ Petition alleging that certain forest lands were being illegally diverted for non-forest purposes.
Comments: It's not on the Sabin's webpage, and on ours I couldn't find any info on when the claim was filed.

Title: Case opened
Comments: Couldn't find it

Title: Case opened
Comments: It's not on the Sabin's webpage, and on ours I couldn't find any info on when the claim was filed.

Title: Case opened
Comments: It's not on the Sabin's webpage, and on ours I couldn't find any info on when the claim was filed.

Title: Case opened
Comments: No information on when the case was filed. The case is still open.

Title: Case decided
Description: The demandant sough judicial review of the decision that declared the validity of the penalty and the lack of rights to compensation due to the obligation to reforestate the permanent preservation area in his land.
Comments: I couldn't find any information on when the claim was filed.

Title: Case on Appeal
Description: The demandant appealed the decision before the Superior Justice Tribunal (national tribunal).

Title: Case decided
Comments: I couldn't find any information on the dates of filing or judgement.

Title: Civil proceeding began
Description: The Federal Prosecutor filed a civil proceeding against the group responsible for draining and clearing a mangrove forest and putting a landfill and various structures in its place.
Comments: I found the information relating to the dates on the Tribunal's webpage: https://ww2.stj.jus.br/processo/pesquisa/?tipoPesquisa=tipoPesquisaNumeroRegistro&termo=200302217860&totalRegistrosPorPagina=40&aplicacao=processos.ea

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court ordered the defendants to restore the forest.

Title: Fine imposed
Description: The Federal Environmental Agency fined the appellants (Mr. Filho) for burning roughly 600 hectares of land to clear it for livestock grazing.
Comments: We don't know the exact date the fine was issued.

Title: Case handed to the Superior Justice Tribunal
Description: The Case is handed to the STJ for revision

Title: Case decided
Description: The Superior Court of Justice upheld the Federal Environmental Agency's fine on the grounds that the fine was valid under the National Environmental Policy Act. Case referred to the Regional Court TRF 1st Region on 13/10/2009

Title: Case decided
Description: Decision upheld
Comments: https://ww2.stj.jus.br/processo/pesquisa/?tipoPesquisa=tipoPesquisaNumeroOrigem&termo=199701000099261&totalRegistrosPorPagina=40&aplicacao=processos.ea

Title: Questioned project approved
Description: The Ministry of Environment approved the Adani mining project.

Title: Case opened
Description: The Australian Conservation Foundation (ACF) challenged the Minister's decision to approve the opening of the Carmichael Coal Mine.
Lower Court initially rejected the ACF's application.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: ACF appealed the decision.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Federal Court then dismissed the appeal on the basis that neither the lower court nor the Minister had fallen into legal error.

Title: Case opened
Description: Yelland Wind Farm Ltd. appealed a decision by the West Devon Borough Council refusing planning permission for a wind farm proposal on the edge of Dartmoor National Park.
The Planning Inspector dismissed the appeal

Title: Case opened
Description: The local planning authority challenged an Inspector's approval of a permit application for a residential development.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court dismissed the application.

Title: Case opened
Description: Veolia appealed decision to deny permission for a waste to energy facility as an extension to an existing recycling center in Shropshire, England.

Title: Case decided
Description: Planning permission was granted given that benefits of the plant would outweigh the costs.
The Ministry of Energy granted permission to build windfarm in Scottish coast.

Title: Case opened
Description: Trump International challenged the decision of the permission awarded to Aberdeen Offshore Wind Farm Limited (AOWL) to build a wind farm.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court ruled in favor of AOWFL and the Ministry.

Title: Case opened
Description: Stuart Dimmock challenged the decision to distribute the documentary An Inconvenient Truth to English state schools as a teaching aid.

Title: Case decided
Description: Court ruled that the filmed could be shown undertwo conditions.

Title: Case opened
Description: Sustainable Shetland challenged the Scottish Minister's approval of an application by Viking Energy for the construction and operation of a 457 megawatt Wind Farm

Title: Successful
Description: The Court ruled in favor of Sustainable Shetland.

Title: Case opened
Description: Four solar energy companies challenged a decision of the Secretary of State for Energy and Climate Change (the Secretary) to discontinue a renewable energy support scheme.

Title: Unsuccesful
Description: The Court upheld the government's decision and found that the Secretary acted within his authority.

Title: Case opened
Description: Npower Renewables appealed the decision to deny permission for a six-turbine wind farm in Lincolnshire, England

Title: Appeal dismissed
Description: The Inspector concludes that the costs of the project would outweigh the benefits, the appeal was denied.

Title: Case opened
Description: Rockware Glass Ltd challenged the decision of the City Council to grant a Planning Pollution Control License to a commercial rival.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court upheld a decision

Title: Case opened
Description: A local resident challenged the district council's decision of granting a planning permission for a pre-case concrete manufacturing facility project.

Title: Case opened
Description: Swiss International Airlines challenged the EU decision suspending GHG emission allowance trading scheme for some flights to and from the EU, except for Switzerland.

Title: Unsuccesful
Description: The decision was upheld.

Title: Case opened
Description: World Development Movement, PLATFORM, and People & Planet brought suit against the UK Treasury for its lack of adequate environmental and human rights considerations in investing with the Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS) (decision made on 5/08/2009)

Title: Unsuccesful
Description: The High Court denied the request for permission to hold a judicial review over the Treasury's actions.

Title: Case opened
Description: Claimants challenged the Secretary of State's preliminary approval of a third runway at London's Heathrow Airport.

Title: Decision upheld
Description: British high court ordered government officials to consider the implications of climate change prior to making any final decision on a third runway at London's Heathrow Airport.

Title: Claim dismissed
Description: Claim dismissed on the grounds that the court lacked subject matter jurisdiction under the Planning Act 2008.

Title: Case opened
Description: Fight the Fights challenged the decision of the Newham London Borough Council to grant consent to increase the number of flights permitted per year at the London City Airport.

Title: Unsuccesful
Description: The court denied the challenge.

Title: Case opened
Description: Local residents and others challenged the permit for a wind farm (22/09/2011 - permit granted)

Title: Unsuccesful
Description: The court dismissed the appeal finding that the planning policy changes did not warrant reconsideration of the proposal and that all procedural requirements were fulfilled.

Title: Permit denied
Description: Permission for wind farm denied.

Title: Appeal granted
Description: Planning Inspector reversed the local authority's decision on the basis that the benefits of the scheme,

Title: Appeal filed by a thrid party
Description: Claimant, Mr. Pugh, appealed to the High Court of Justice Planning Court.

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The High Court of Justice Planning Court affirmed the judgment of the Planning Inspector.

Title: Case opened
Description: NorthCote Farms LTD challenged the decision of a planning Inspector to deny permit for the construction of a windfarm (the decision is dated from 1/08/2014)

Title: Case decided
Description: The High Court of Justice affirmed the local authority's decision on the ground that the project would negatively affect Carnaby Temple, a nearby heritage asset.

Title: Claim filed
Description: Residents challenged an Inspector decision granting planning permissions for the installation of a wind turbine.

Title: Unsuccesful
Description: The court upheld the Inspector's decision.

Title: Case opened
Description: Petitioners challenged the local council's denial of planning applications for the construction of two wind farms.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Inspector heard the appeals jointly and overturned the council's decision, allowing for the wind farms to be constructed.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: Informal citizen groups challenged the Inspector's decisions in the High Court of Justice.

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The court upheld the Inspector's decision.

Title: Case opened
Description: Laughton Wind Farm Ltd. appealed a decision by the West Lindsey Borough Council refusing planning permission for a proposal to build 10 wind turbines.

Title: Case decided
Description: Appeal dismissed

Title: Case opened
Description: Lark Energy Ltd. challenged the decision of the Secretary for State Communities (Secretary) to dismiss its appeal against the refusal for the installation of a solar farm.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court overruled the Secretary's decision

Title: Case opened
Description: KS SPV35 Ltd. appealed the Monmouthshire County Council's rejection of its application to install a solar farm.

Title: Permission granted
Description: The Inspector granted the permission.

Title: Case opened
Description: Court acquitted climate change activists of causing criminal damage at a coal-fired power station.

Title: Case opened
Description: Community members challenged an Inspector's decision to overturn the refusal of an application to erect a wind turbine (decision from 19/03/2012).

Title: Appeal successful
Description: The court upheld the appeal and quashed the Inspector's decision.

Title: Permit denied
Description: The Quinn brothers requested a permit to develop a renewable energy wind-farm in their lands in Northern Ireland, the request was denied.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: The applicants sought judicial review of a Planning Commissioner's refusal to their permit request before the Planning Appeals Commission.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court ruled the Commissioner failed to properly consider the benefits of the wind farm and granted the permit.

Title: Case opened
Description: A UK court granted injunctive relief to control a probable campaign of direct action and civil disobedience by environmental activists in the immediate vicinity of Heathrow airport.

Title: Case opened
Description: Local residents challenged the decision of a Planning Inspector to grant permission for the development of a wind farm.

Title: Dismissed
Description: The claim was dismissed.

Title: Case opened
Description: Hertfordshire County Council challenged the decision of the Secretary to grant permission for urban expansion (decision from 1/02/2012)

Title: Successful
Description: The court agreed with the petitioners and quashed the Secretary's decision.

Title: Case opened
Description: Greenpeace challenged the decision to develop new nuclear plants in the UK arguing the consultation process for the project was flawed.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court ruled that the process was flawed, but didn't quash the order, it granted declaratory relief.

Title: Case opened
Description: Mr. Nicholson filed an employment discrimination claim alleging that his employer terminated him due to his belief in CC.

Title: Case decided
Description: Employment Tribunal's finding that the belief in climate change was a protected belief under the Employment Equality.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: The employer appealed this decision.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Employment Appeal Tribunal dismissed the appeal

Title: Case opened
Description: Claimant appealed the denial of planning permit for a residential development where a similar proposed development was approved for the same property by the previous landowner.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court found for the Claimant, the permit was granted.

Title: Case opened
Description: Deutsche Bank (DB) sued Total Global Steel (TGS) for breach of contract for the sale of Certified Emissions Reductions (CERs).

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court ordered TGS to pay damages to DB.

Title: Case opened
Description: A building and construction company appealed a local council failure to determine within a prescribed period an application for the erection of eight wind turbines.

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The Planning Inspector concluded that the proposal would unacceptably harm the surrounding landscapes, dismissed the appeal.

Title: Case opened
Description: Local residents challenged two proposals for the construction of wind turbines.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Inspector found that these benefits clearly outweighed the possible harms.

Title: Case opened
Description: A construction company appealed a local council failure to determine within the prescribed period an application for the erection of 3 wind turbine generators.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Planning Inspector concluded the harm that the proposal would cause to the surrounding landscape outwighed the beenfits.

Title: Case opened
Description: Local residents challenged two proposals for the construction of wind turbines, arguing that the harms outweighed the economic or environmental benefits.

Title: Challenge unsuccessful
Description: Planning Inspector found that the proposals would provide significant benefits, permit was upheld.

Title: Case opened
Description: CFP brought suit against Barclays and Tricorona for misuse of condidential information.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court held Barclays and Tricorona jointly liable for each other's breaches of confidentiality

Title: Case opened
Description: Cemex UK field a claim arguing that Phase II of the National Allocation Plan (NAP) seriously disadvantaged one of its plants, violating the principle of equity.

Title: Claim unsuccessful.
Description: The Court dismissed the application.

Title: Case opened
Description: Claimants challenged the decision by the Welsh Ministers to refuse to grant a planning permit for a mixed-use redevelopment.

Title: Appeal unsuccessful.
Description: The court found that the Minister's determination that there were impermissible flood risks at the site was fair and reasonable. Appeal dismissed.

Title: Case opened
Description: Farmers appealed the refusal of planning permission for two wind turbines.

Title: Case opened
Description: The Inspector decided the benefits are outweighed by the unacceptable harm to the character and appearance of the distinctive local landscape.

Title: Case opened
Description: Bellis (Corp) appealed the decision of a local planning authority in Wales to deny the application to construct 3 wind turbine generators in a Historic Landscape Area.

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The administrative court found that the proposed wind turbines would have a significantly detrimental effect on the historic landscape.

Title: Case opened
Description: Stop Stansted Expansion challenged the grant of planning permission relating to the increase in capacity of Stansted Airport (decision from 08/10/2008)

Title: Application dismissed
Description: the court held that the government had considered the impacts of the proposed development on climate change. The application was dismissed.

Title: Case opened
Description: Claimants opposed the designation of two locations as proposed ecotowns arguing the process had insufficient consultation.

Title: Claim dismissed
Description: The court found that the government's approach to consultation was sufficient and dismissed the claim.

Title: Case opened
Description: Armstrong was affected by a fraudulent email which resulted in the transfer of some of its EUA to Winnington. The case is to decide which party should bare the costs of the fraud. Armstrong filed a claim on 3 alternative bases.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court classified EUAs as intangible property at common law. Hence, EUAs may be subject to restitutionary claims, and Armstrong was entitled to a money judgment.

Title: Case opened
Description: Cumbria Wind Farms Ltd. appealed local council decision refusing planning permission for the erection of six wind turbines near a national park.

Title: Appeal dismissed
Description: The Planning Inspector affirmed the local council's decision, concluding that the adverse visual effects in this particular case outweigh the need for renewable energy

Title: Case opened
Description: The defendants were convicted for the manipulation of the EU Emissions Trade Scheme.

Title: Case on Appeal
Description: The defendants appealed this decision.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court determined that the given sentences were too high and reduced the sentences to 13 years, 10 years and 8 years.

Title: Case opened
Description: Tate & Lyle requested judicial review of their allocation of 1.0 Renewables Obligations Certificates (ROC) for the use of co-firing of biomass with combined heat power (CHP) ( they argued they shuld have recieved 1.5)

Title: Claim dismissed
Description: The claim was dismissed.

Title: First hearing
Description: Environment-People-Law (EPL) sought to compel the Ministry of Environmental Protection to develop a climate change policy for Ukraine
Comments: The date corresponds to the first hearing, not to the date when the claim was filed.

Title: Claim successful
Description: The Commercial Court of Lviv Region ruled a decision in favour of EPL

Title: Appeal filed
Description: The Ministry of Environmental Protection filed an appeal.

Title: Case opened
Description: Environment-People-Law (EPL) filed suit against the government, seeking to compel the dissemination of information on international greenhouse gas emissions trading. Case still not decided.

Title: Case opened
Description: Urgenda Foundation, and 900 Dutch citizens sued the Dutch government to require it to do more to prevent global climate change.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court in the Hague ordered the Dutch state to limit GHG emissions to 25% below 1990 levels by 2020.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: The Dutch Government appealed this decision.

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The Hague Court of Appeal upheld the District Court's ruling, concluding that by failing to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by at least 25% by end-2020, the Dutch government is acting unlawfully.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: The Dutch government appealed the decision before the Netherlands' Supreme Court.

Title: Formal opinion issued
Description: The Advocate and Procurator General, independent judicial officers, issued a formal opinion recommending that the Supreme Court uphold the decision. The case is yet to be decided.

Title: Case opened
Description: A group of senior women, filed suit against the Swiss Government, alleging it had violated several articles under the constitution, including the right to life.

Title: Claim dismissed
Description: The petition was dismissed by the Department of Environment, Transport, Energy, and Communications (DETEC).

Title: Appeal filed
Description: Petitioners appealed the dismissal.

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The Swiss Federal Administrative Court dismissed the case

Title: Case opened
Description: An energy retailing company filed a suit against the Government Administration of Spain, challenging Royal Decree 1370/2006.

Title: Case decided
Description: Court found that rules setting standards for SO2 emissions were null and void since they weren't specifically authorized by Spain's implementing statute for the EU's Directive 2003/87/EC.
Comments: Link to the document is not working, we should update our website.

Title: Case opened
Description: Segura, S.L., brought suit against a decision of the Council of Ministers of Spain which approved the assignment of emission credits to the company.

Title: Case decided
Description: Court found that the decision of the Council was invalid and ordered the Council to conduct the assignment of credits anew.

Title: Case opened
Description: Cermica General Castaos brought suit against the decision of the Council of Ministers of Spain of January 21, 2005 approving the assignment of emission credits to its facility .
Comments: Link to the document is not working, we should update our website.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court annulled the individual assignment of emissions credits and ordered that a new calculation take place in harmony with its findings.

Title: Case opened
Description: Cales de Llierca, S.A., brought suit against the Council of Ministers of Spain challenging their decision of January 21, 2005 approving the individual assignment of emissions credits to its lime processing facility for the 2005-2007 period.
Comments: Link to the document is not working, we should update our website.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court ruled in favor of Cales de Llierca and ordered the Council to conduct a new assignment of credits.

Title: Case opened
Description: Ladri Bailn, brick manufacturer, brought suit against a decision of the Council of Ministers of Spain of approving the assignment of emission allowances to its factory in Bailn (57,033 tons of CO2 for the 2005-2007)
Comments: Link to the document is not working, we should update our website.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Ministry of the Environment was ordered to conduct a new assignment of credits.

Title: Case opened
Description: Ladri Bailn, brick manufacturer, brought suit against a decision of the Council of Ministers of Spain of approving the assignment of emission allowances to its factory in Bailn (43.746 tons of CO2 for 2005-2007)

Title: Case decided
Description: The Ministry of the Environment was ordered to conduct a new assignment of credits.

Title: Case opened
Description: Arcelor Espaa challenged the decision of the Council of Ministers of Spain declaring the individual assignment of emissions credits for the 2005-2007 term.
Comments: Link to the document is not working, we should update our website.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court rejected Arcelor's arguments and dismissed its request for remedy

Title: Case opened
Description: Electra de Viesgo Distribuci_n brought suit challenging the individual assignment of emissions credits.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court found in favor of plaintiffs.

Title: Case opened
Description: Cermica Dolores Garc_a Bazataqui brought suit challenging the decision of the Council of Ministers of Spain that declared the individual assignment of emissions allowances for the 2005-2007 term.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court dismissed the petition.

Title: Case opened
Description: Cermica Hermanos Fernndez brought suit against the General Government Administration of Spain challenging the decision approving an individual assignment of emissions credits to its facility.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court denied Cermica's petition.

Title: Case opened
Description: Minera Catalana Aragonesa brought suit against the General Government Administration of Spain challenging the decision approving the individual assignment of emissions credits to its ceramics facility

Title: Case decided
Description: The court found in Minera Catalana's favor

Title: Case opened
Description: Foraneto brought suit against the Council of Ministers of Spain challenging their decision to approve the individual assignment of emissions credits to its energy plant.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court ruled in Faraneto's favor and changed the assignment to a total of 174,508 tons for the 2005-2007 period.

Title: Case opened
Description: Uni_n Fenosa Generaci_n brought suit against a decision of the Council of Ministers whereby it approved the assignment of emissions allowances to two of the company's power plants.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court found that the government was justified in applying the maximum penalty of 55% over the total 2000-2002 historical emissions for that category of emitter.

Title: Case opened
Description: Greenpeace Southeast Asia and numerous other organizations and individuals filed a petition asking the Commission to investigate a general issuethe human rights implications of climate change and ocean acidification and the resulting rights violations in the Philippines.

Title: First hearings
Description: In march 2018 the Commission held the first public hearings. Case is not yet decided.

Title: Case opened
Description: Ashgar Leghari, a Pakistani farmer, sued the national government for failure to carry out the 2012 National Climate Policy and Framework.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court determined that "the delay and lethargy of the State in implementing the Framework offend the fundamental rights of the citizens, and created a Climate Change Commission.

Title: Supplemental decision
Description: The court issued supplemental decision naming 21 individuals to the Climate Change Commission and vesting it with various powers.

Title: Judgement pending
Description: Rabab Ali, a 7-year-old girl challenged to various actions and inactions on the part of Pakistan's federal government and on the part of the Province of Sindh regarding climate change. Judgement is pending.

Title: Case opened
Description: Jonah Gbemre, a representative of the Iwherekan community in the Niger Delta filed suit against the Nigerian government and Shell to stop stop flaring gas in the Niger Delta.

Title: Claim successful
Description: The court held that the practice of gas flaring is unconstitutional as it violates the guaranteed fundamental rights of life and dignity.

Title: Case opened
Description: Buller Coal Ltd. and Solid Energy Ltd. applied for consent to operate a coal mine for export purposes, they sought consent from the Environment Court that the end use of the coal was irrelevant to the resource consents.

Title: Consent granted
Description: The Environment Court granted consent, on the grounds that under the Resource Management Act it wasn't necessary to have regard for the effects on climate change.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: West Coast ENT and Royal Forest and Bird Protection Society challenged this decision.

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The High Court upheld the decision by the Environment Court.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: West Coast ENT and Royal Forest and Bird Protection Society challenged this decision.

Title: Appeal successful
Description: The Supreme Court overturned the previous decisions, concluding that the lower courts had wrongly construed the Act. It held instead that such considerations for cliamte change were not just permissible but obligatory.

Title: Case opened
Description: Citizen groups challenged the granting of resource consents to Unison Networks Limited to construct and operate a wind farm.

Title: Appeal successful
Description: The court determined that despite the benefits of the wind farm, the proposed project would have significant adverse effects on an outstanding natural landscape.

Title: Appeal filed
Description: Unison Networks Limited  appealed this decision.

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The High Court found no error as a matter of law and dismissed the appeal.

Title: Case opened
Description: Sarah Thomson, a New Zealand law student, filed a Statement of Claim against New Zealand's Minister of Climate Change Issues alleging that he had failed in several respects regarding the setting of GHG emissions reduction targets required by New Zealand's Climate Change Response Act of 2002.

Title: Claim unsuccessful.
Description: The Court found that the Minister had not done any reviewable error, hence the claim was dismissed.

Title: Case opened
Description: Details on case 7157
Comments: This case is the same as 7157 which I detailed above

Title: Case opened
Description: Details on case 7156
Comments: This case is the same as 7156 which I detailed above.

Title: Case opened
Description: The New Zealand Climate Science Education Trust (Trust) sought judicial review of climate data published by a government owned research institute, on the grounds it has used the wrong methodology.

Title: Claim unsuccessful
Description: The High Court held that the research institute had used credible scientific methods to carry out its work and there was no basis for judicial review. It ordered the Trust to bare the costs of the judicial action. The trust appealed this decision, and the appeal was dismissed.

Title: Case opened
Description: Motorimu Wind Farm appealed a city council's partial denial of resource consents for a proposed wind farm.

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The court agreed with the City Council and held that the turbines would have significant adverse landscape impacts. It declined the appeal for all but 4 turbines.

Title: Case opened
Description: Makara residents challenged the approval for a wind farm in the area.

Title: Application dismissed
Description: The Court upheld the decision.

Title: Case opened
Description: A family from Tuvalu appealed after they were denied New Zealand resident visas on the grounds that if deported to Tuvalu they would face adverse impacts of climate change.

Title: Appeal successful
Description: The appeal was granted based on other reasons, the Tribunal explicitly declined to reach the question of whether climate change provided a basis for granting resident visas.

Title: Case opened
Description: The Imported Motor Vehicle Industry Association (IMVIA) sought judicial review of the Transport Ministry's emissions standards for used cars imported into New Zealand.

Title: Judicial review denied
Description: The court dismissed the IMVIA's application for review.

Title: Case opened
Description: Greenpeace challenged a regional council's decision to consent to a proposed coal-fired power station.

Title: Appeal successful
Description: The court held, under the Resource Management Act 1991, that a consent authority can consider the effects of such discharge on climate change.

Title: Case opened
Description: The Environmental Defence Society sought government imposition of mitigation measures in granting consent for a power station.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Environment Court dismissed the appeal, questioning the efficacy of imposing mitigation measures.

Title: Case opened
Description: Applicants challenged the granting of resource consents to Meridian Energy for the construction of a wind farm using up to 176 wind turbines.

Title: Appeal successful
Description: The Environment Court determined that the project did not comply with the Resource Management Act because the substantial adverse impacts on the natural landscape.

Title: Case on Appeal
Description: Meridian appealed this decision.

Title: Appeal successful
Description: The High Court of New Zealand allowed the appeal and remanded the case back to the Environment Court.

Title: Case opened
Description: A Kiribati citizen appealed the denial of refugee status in the New Zealand High Court (Decision of the High Court 25/06/2013)

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The High Court refused the leave to appeal from that decision.

Title: Case on Appeal
Description: Mr. Teitiota appealed the decision of the High Court.

Title: Appeal denied
Description: The Cour of Appeal dismissed the application.

Title: Case on Appeal
Description: Mr. Teitiota appealed the decision of the Court of Appeal.

Title: Appeal denied
Description: The Supreme Court denied the Appeal.

Title: Case opened
Description: Greenpeace appealed to the Supreme Court on the question of the proper interpretation of s 104E of the Resource Management Act 1991, regarding the consideration of GHG emissions for non-renewable energy projects.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Supreme Court of NZ agreed that GHG emissions should be considered, overturning the decision of the court of Appeals.

Title: Case opened
Description: The Franklin District Council challenged the consent for a wind farm project on the grounds of adverse impacts on the landscape.

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The Environment Court of NZ upheld the decision, granting the permit for the project.

Title: Case opened
Description: An Taisce and Friends of the Irish Environment challenged the approval of Edenderry Power Ltd.'s application to extend operation of its peat- and biomass-burning power plant from 2015 to 2023.

Title: Appeal successful
Description: The High Court granted the appeal and overturned the permission.

Title: Case decided
Description: The NGT in its own motion concluded that the government of Himachal Pradesh had violated its obligations by failing to restrict development and road and pedestrian traffic in and around the increasingly touristed area accessible via the Rohatang Pass (it should Halt and reverse receding of glaciers near Rohatang Pass).

Title: Case opened
Description: Two journalists filed a lawsuit againt the Ministry of Environment for using their names in a pamphlet about climate change, presenting them as cliamte skeptics.

Title: Claim unsuccessful
Description: The Court dimissed the suit arguing the Ministry is responsible to inform and educate the public about environmental issues, this includes presenting all points of view.

Title: Case opened
Description: BUND and Germanwatch brought suit against the government arguing that citizens have a right to the free access of environmental information under the German Access to Environmental Information Act (UIG).

Title: Case decided
Description: The Administrative court granted the application, rejecting the argument that information on German export credit activities did not constitute environmental information.

French Constitutional Council annulled a tax on carbon emissions (set at 17 Euro/CO2et) on the grounds that the proposed tax contained too many exemptions and would not have applied to 93% of industrial emissions.
Comments: There isn't any document attached, so I couldn't check the dates (if there is time, could check the link I put beside)

Title: Case decided
Description: The French Constitutional Council upheld the validity of article 64 regarding the purchase of GHG emissions quotas for 2011, whereas quotas were distributed free of charge in 2010. The quota purchase will only apply for 2011 and 2012. This had been challenged by some companies that hadn't received their quotas even though they carried out activities in 2010.

Title: Case opened
Description: Companies challenged decree n2004-832, which transposed the EU directive 13/10/2003 establishing a system of exchange of GHG emission quotas arguing it was illegal.

Title: Case transferred
Description: The French Constitutional Council transferred the case to EU Court of Justice.

Title: Case decided
Description: The European Court of Justice held that the directive did not violate the principle of equality

Title: Case opened
Description: Industrie de bois de Vielsalm (IBV) challenged the refusal of green ceritficates.

Title: Case referred
Description: The Constitutional Court of Belgium referred these issues to the EU Court of Justice.

Title: Appeal denied
Description: The Court of Justice found Walloon's interpretation of biomass (excluded because of negative imapcts) was permissible under the Directive given its purpose.

Title: Case opened
Description: Arcelor challenged the adoption of Directive 2003/87 under the principle of equality.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court found that the differences were justified, dismissed the claim.

Title: Case opened
Description: the Czech Republic requested a preliminary ruling from the European Court of Justice on the question of whether Article 10 of Directive 2003/87 precludes application of the Czech gift tax to emissions allowances obtained free of charge.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court concluded that the gift tax was inconsistent with Article 10.

Title: Case opened
Description: Poland challenged the adoption of Directive 2003/87/EC on 4 grounds.

Title: Case decided
Description: The General Court rejected all 4 grounds and the action was dismissed

Title: Case opened
Description: Poland challenged the European Commission's decision that its National Allocation Plan was inconsistent with Directive 2003/87.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court held that this decision exceeded the commission's authority.

Title: Case opened
Description: Estonia challenged the European Commission's decision that its National Allocation Plan was inconsistent with Directive 2003/87.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court held that the Commission did not properly examine the NAP and infringed on the principle of sound administration.

Title: Case opened
Description: The UK challenged the European COmmission's decision to reject its amendments to its NAP.

Title: Case decided
Description: The court found that the Commission made an error of law in rejecting the amendments proposed by the UK as inadmissible.

Title: Case opened
Description: Advocate General Sharpston was asked for guidance as to the meaning of the term dual use' in the second indent of Article 2(4)(b) in relation to sugar production and lime fertilizer, the by-product arising from that process, of the Directive 2003/96/EC.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Advocate General answered that dual use' within the meaning of Article 2(4)(b) refers to where coal is used as heating fuel in a lime-kiln in order to generate carbon dioxide for the production of lime-kiln gas, which is subsequently used for the purification of the raw juice obtained from sugar beets, that process giving rise to the by-product earth foam

Title: Case opened
Description: Lafarge Cement challenged the Commission's decision to reject the Polish Phase II national allocation plan (NAP) for the allocation of GHG emission.

Title: Claim dismissed
Description: The Court dismissed all actions as inadmissible because the Commission's decision did not directly and individually affect the Applicants.

Title: Case opened
Description: Electricity producers challenged Spain's amendment to its system for purchasing wholesale electricity.

Title: Case referred
Description: The case was referred to the European Court of Justice.

Title: Case decided
Description: The European Court of Justice rejected the electricity producers arguments

Title: Case opened
Description: Applicants challenged the Commission of the European Communities' decision rejecting the Polish Phase II national allocation plan (NAP)

Title: Application dismissed
Description: The Court dismissed all actions as inadmissible.

Title: Case opened
Description: Green Networks challenged the decision of rejection to its request of exemption of buying green certificates.

Title: Case referred
Description: Italy referred the case to the European Court of Justice.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court held that the Italian law was precluded since guarantees of origin fall within an area largely covered by EU law.

Title: Case opened
Description: Applicants in the above actions challenged the Commission of the European Communities' decision rejecting the Polish Phase II national allocation plan (NAP) .

Title: Action dismissed
Description: The court dismissed the action as inadmissible.

Title: Case opened
Description: Flachglas Torgau requested information about Germany's allocation of emissions licenses during 2005-2007, denied on the grounds of confidentiality. Flachglas challenged this decision.

Title: Case decided
Description: the court upheld the Ministry's decision to deny access to the documents requested.

Title: Case opened
Description: Applicants sought to annul Commission decision rejecting part of the German Phase II national allocation plan (NAP).

Title: Appeal unsuccessful
Description: The Court dismissed the case.

Title: Alleged offense occurred
Description: Protesters block road for 11 hours preventing work to be done. They protest against the authorisation to Cuadrilla by the Oil and Gas Authority to begin fracking to explore for shale gas at a site near Preston New Road.

Title: Case closed
Description: Defendants were convicted of public nuisance, and the judge determined that their conduct crossed the "custody threshold" justifying a sentence of detention.

Title: Alleged offense occurred
Description: Climate activists occupy northern runway of Heathrow Airport, protesting against airport expansion.

Title: Case decided
Description: Court found them guilty of aggravated trespass and entering a security restricted area of an aerodrome without permission. They were sentenced to unpaid work hours.

Title: Law of interest passed
Description: Parlament adopted the Law Energy-Climat

Title: External Contribution filed
Description: NGO "Notre affaire  tous" (NAAT) files an external contribution at the French Constitutional Council, arguing that the bill does not comply with the environmental obligation of vigilance.

Title: Exempt Resolution issued
Description: The Executive Director of the Environmental Evaluation Service (SEA) issues the Exempt Resolution No. 0914 in relation to the proposed hydroelectric project Central Hidrolectrica Cuervo in the region of Aysn.

Title: First hearing
Description: The plaintiffs present their case at the Environmental Court of Valdivia.

Title: Case decided
Description: Court decided - it annulled the Environmental Assessment Service's approval of the project since it failed to provide sufficient compensation for disruption to wetlands and forests. It ordered that the assessment procedure be reopened. It also concluded that the EIA needs to only analyze local impacts, hence climate concerns can be excluded.

Title: Exempt Resolution issued
Description: Approval of EIA project - Exempt Resolution No. 6 by the Environmental Evaluation Commission of the Magallanes and Antartic Region.

Title: First hearing
Description: Plaintiffs present first petition to theExecutive Director of the Environmental Evaluation Service (SEA) to cancel the approval of the EIA of the project Incorporation of blasting as a complementary method in the mechanical extraction of sterile material in the Winter Mine."

Title: Exempt Resolution issued
Description: The Executive Director of SEA issues the Exempt Resolution No. 1113 - rejects the pleintiffs petition.

Title: Claim filed
Description: The plaintiffs file a claim againts E.R. 1113/2018at the Environmental Court of Valdivia.

Title: Case decided(decision appealed)
Description: The Court decided: it annulled the E.R. 1113/2018, but considers Chile's international commitments don't impose that climate change is considered in EIA. It annulled the approval of the EIA on other grounds. The operator has appealed this decision.

Title: First hearing
Description: Court analyzed case for the first time - administrative judge ordered the parties to provide their written positions on the issues raised.

Title: Alleged offense occurred
Description: Two citizens (Delahalle and Goinvic) remove from a city hall in Lyon a portrait of President Macron as a protest for non-compliance with the Paris Agreement.

Title: First hearing
Description: The defendants present their case. Experts present evidence on climate change, and the Governments (insufficient) efforts to attain its objectives.

Title: Case closed
Description: The Court decided: it agrees that climate change seriously endangers the future of humanity. Based on the evidence that the Government's objectives will no be achieved, it concluded that citizens in these circumstances can use other means of expression (thay cannot be limited to voting).

Title: Case decided
Description: The ICJ determines Nicaragua's activities are unlawful and violated Costa Rica's territorial sovereignty.

Title: Case closed
Description: The ICJ rules how much Nicaragua must compensate Cosra Rica for the loss of environmental services (US$ 120.000)

Title: Case closed
Description: The High Court of Lahore decided: to allow the writ of mandamus, ordering the Government to fulfill its obligations under the law. Additionally, it gave instructions to the government bodies to consider revising requirements and penalties under the Trees Act, publish annual reports on expansion of the forest area, impose penalties against delinquent officers, and to issue directions to the housing societies and authorities to support the planting of trees in the green belt and issue penalties for cutting those trees down.

Title: Case decided
Description: The High Court of Justice decided that paragraph 209(a)is unlawful since Government failed to take into account scientific and technical evidence, and since the public consultation process was unfair.

Title: Policy of interest modified.
Description: The Secretary issued a statement to remove paragraph 209(a).

Title: Policy of interest modified.
Description: The Government updated the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF).

Title: Case referred to the EU Court of Justice
Description: The Administrative Court referred the case to the EU Court of Justice for a preliminary ruling regarding if this facility was entitiled to GHG allowances free of charge.

Title: Case decided by EU Court of Justice
Description: The Court of Justice concluded that the facility is not entitled to be allocated free emission allowances.

Title: Law of interest issued
Description: Part 5 of Bill C-74 becomes a law. This is the GHG Pollution Pricing Act (GGPPA) establishes a federal price for GHG emissions in any province/territory that has not implemented carbon pricing regime, effective as of January 2019.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Court of Appeal for Saskatchewan ruled that the GGPPA is not unconstitutional.

Title: Complaint filed
Description: Michael Mann (scientist) filed a claim against Tomothy Ball, the Frontier Centre for Public Policy (FCPP) and another, for defamatory statements on interview inferring that Mann was guilty of fraud relating to Climategate scandal.

Title: Retraction and apology by FCPP
Description: The FCPP issued a retraction and apology on their website.

Title: Case dismissed
Description: The Court dismissed the case on account of delay.

Title: Motion for dimissal denied
Description: Defendant's motion for summary dismissal is denied.

Title: First decision
Description: The Court found that the Defendant had an implied authority. To emit some amount of CO2 in generating electricity, but this amount is limited to a reasonable regard and care for people and the environment.

Title: Case decided on Appeal
Description: Court of appeals reversed the lower court's decision, arguing that common law principles only protected private rights.

Title: EIA License issued to Amu Power Company
Description: The National Environmental Management Authority (NEMA) issued EIA License to Amu Power Comany Limited.

Title: Tribunal visits site
Description: Tribunal visits the site of the Proposed project.

Title: Case decided
Description: The Tribunal decided that the NEMA violated the EIA and Audit regulations by granting the License without the proper particiaption process. It found that the EIA study was incomplete and scientifically insufficient. Also it didn't take into account CC.The tribunal ordered Amu Power Company to conduct a new EIA study in compliance with regulations, it should also include all approved architectural and engineering plans for the plant and its ancillary facilities.

Title: Fine imposed related to the EU Directive 2003/87/EC
Description: In November 2011 German authorities requested a report of emissions allowances to company Ziegelwerk Hxter GmbH during insolvency procedure, but company refused because it had ceased activities before the procedure began.German authorities imposed a fine of 100 per non-surrendered ton of CO2 equivalent.
